body: Please include the log file. The amount of logs you've pasted here isn't helpful.

[video2x_error.log](https://github.com/k4yt3x/video2x/files/5823967/video2x_error.log)

For multiprocess error, check this

in second case, it just waited for it and nothing happened so tried with different setting, its still waiting... and even if I stop it, no log files are left. how can I see some ffmpeg progress bar in some way?

Seems to be a CUDA/cuDNN issue.
Single process works?

yes, single process works if I use SSD as a cache drive. 
mutlprocess fails always.
definitely there's something wrong with my HDD or some 4K random read bottleneck... I'll check it more with new SSD too
It's weird you find it to be a storage issue. The error log says `CUDNN_STATUS_NOT_INITIALIZED`, which indicates it's a GPU issue.

Even with same setup, sometimes it fails even before upscaling start... and found that extraction process itself stopped with some wierd clicking sound. However I can't catch any bad sectors or something with it... so not being really sure about it.

If I understood correctly, if I see 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35677394/104884225-5ed08100-59a9-11eb-81f3-6722a8085927.png)
this, cudnn upscaling is working after extracting frames, right?
In singleprocess, it works. and as I set 1x so additional lanzcos downscaling happens and ffmpeg should work after it. (but sometimes ffmpeg fails to merge or extract....)

In multiprocess, Extracting frame is okay(well, sometimes fails too) but upscaling fails. (proceses : 2+) as you read, it says cudnn status success issue.

and I just found that extracting process can just stop with no reason, huh. stopping and restarting it (not the process, just upscaling) helps. I checked file Write/Read speed is low so got into cache directory and found that only some frames are extracted... (happened at SSD)

For reference, video used at setup is [this](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ydmF-WoL59s), and it STOPPED there.

Briefly, I think there's ffmpeg instability problem for some reason, and cudnn multiprocess problem. 
*and I actually just use CMD and execute that last command, then it works normally. it yeets up cpu and does its job.


Found that '1X' setting causes some of the problem. 2X works with multiprocess, singleprocess... but 1X does not work with singleprocess, throws error with multiprocess. how?

It's not really recommended to use multi-processing on machine-learning-based drivers (waifu2x, SRMD, RealSR), especially wifu2x-caffe, since it offers no native multi-threading/processing support. It's the best to use just a single thread since multi-threading them makes no significant improvements.

I have the feeling that your GPU is just overloaded, whether VRAM or something else.
